categories.body: Episodes of Avatar: The Last Airbender

links.body: Sozin's Comet, Part 2: The Old Masters

paragraphs.body: "Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King" is the 18th episode of ${link_0} of ${link_1} and the 58th of the overall series. It debuted on July 19, 2008.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: "Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King" is the 18th episode of Book Three: Fire of Avatar: The Last Airbender and the 58th of the overall series. It debuted on July 19, 2008.

paragraphs.body: Aang prepares himself to fight Fire Lord Ozai, but has difficulty deciding how to defeat him without taking his life. His friends push him, urging him to kill the Fire Lord, but Aang insists it goes against his beliefs. In his sleep, Aang is drawn toward a mysterious island that appears suddenly in the sea. His friends find June, the bounty hunter, to attempt to locate him again. Fire Lord Ozai crowns himself Phoenix King and Aang awakens on the unknown island now in the middle of the sea.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Aang prepares himself to fight Fire Lord Ozai, but has difficulty deciding how to defeat him without taking his life. His friends push him, urging him to kill the Fire Lord, but Aang insists it goes against his beliefs. In his sleep, Aang is drawn toward a mysterious island that appears suddenly in the sea. His friends find June, the bounty hunter, to attempt to locate him again. Fire Lord Ozai crowns himself Phoenix King and Aang awakens on the unknown island now in the middle of the sea.

paragraphs.body: At the ${link_0}'s ${link_1}, ${link_2} is practicing his ${link_3} while ${link_4} watches and demands more ferocity from him. At first, Aang makes a feeble attempt at a particular move, but does much better with the next attempt. Everyone else is lazily sitting on the steps of the beach house. ${link_5} prepares watermelon juice for everyone, causing Aang to excitedly abandon his training to get a drink. An angered Zuko criticizes them all for being lazy. ${link_6} and the others, except for an annoyed Zuko, head to the beach to have a party.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: At the Fire Lord's beach house, Aang is practicing his firebending while Zuko watches and demands more ferocity from him. At first, Aang makes a feeble attempt at a particular move, but does much better with the next attempt. Everyone else is lazily sitting on the steps of the beach house. Katara prepares watermelon juice for everyone, causing Aang to excitedly abandon his training to get a drink. An angered Zuko criticizes them all for being lazy. Sokka and the others, except for an annoyed Zuko, head to the beach to have a party.

paragraphs.body: Katara uses ${link_0} to surf on the waves, while Aang and ${link_1} make sand sculptures. After Sokka makes a hideous sand sculpture of ${link_2}, Zuko appears and attacks Aang ferociously, scaring everyone. He chases Aang off the beach and back into the house. Once cornered by Zuko, Aang ${link_3} Zuko out of the house and everyone else asks why Zuko attacked Aang without reason. Angered, Zuko wonders how they can relax and have a party when ${link_4} is arriving in three days. The others reveal that they believe that the ${link_5} already won the War after conquering ${link_6}, and that Aang can just wait until he has fully mastered the elements to defeat the Fire Lord, after the comet passes.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Katara uses waterbending to surf on the waves, while Aang and Toph make sand sculptures. After Sokka makes a hideous sand sculpture of Suki, Zuko appears and attacks Aang ferociously, scaring everyone. He chases Aang off the beach and back into the house. Once cornered by Zuko, Aang airbends Zuko out of the house and everyone else asks why Zuko attacked Aang without reason. Angered, Zuko wonders how they can relax and have a party when Sozin's Comet is arriving in three days. The others reveal that they believe that the Fire Nation already won the War after conquering Ba Sing Se, and that Aang can just wait until he has fully mastered the elements to defeat the Fire Lord, after the comet passes.

paragraphs.body: Just as Katara says that it could not possibly get any worse, Zuko grimly replies that it will. He tells them of the day before the ${link_0} when he attended a war meeting, where he was glad his ${link_1} had finally accepted him back. The generals in the meeting discuss rebellions inside the ${link_2} that must be stopped. Zuko explains that the people of the Earth Kingdom are strong and proud and capable of enduring everything as long as they have hope. Hearing Zuko's words, Ozai believes that they must destroy their hope, and ${link_3} suggests burning down the Earth Kingdom. Ozai accepts this idea and decides to use the power of the comet to permanently crush the Earth Kingdom, just as ${link_4} used its power to wipe out the ${link_5} one hundred years prior. With this last piece of resistance gone, he could rule the ${link_6} unopposed.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Just as Katara says that it could not possibly get any worse, Zuko grimly replies that it will. He tells them of the day before the eclipse when he attended a war meeting, where he was glad his father had finally accepted him back. The generals in the meeting discuss rebellions inside the Earth Kingdom that must be stopped. Zuko explains that the people of the Earth Kingdom are strong and proud and capable of enduring everything as long as they have hope. Hearing Zuko's words, Ozai believes that they must destroy their hope, and Azula suggests burning down the Earth Kingdom. Ozai accepts this idea and decides to use the power of the comet to permanently crush the Earth Kingdom, just as Sozin used its power to wipe out the Air Nomads one hundred years prior. With this last piece of resistance gone, he could rule the world unopposed.

paragraphs.body: As the group displays their horror at this news, Zuko concludes that Aang will have no choice but to defeat Ozai before the comet comes, otherwise there will not be a world to save. Downhearted by this news, Aang feels overwhelmed and doubts his abilities to successfully face the Fire Lord. His friends, however, declare that they will fight alongside him to have a better shot at defeating Ozai. With Aang comforted, ${link_0} joins together in a group hug, including a reluctant Zuko.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: As the group displays their horror at this news, Zuko concludes that Aang will have no choice but to defeat Ozai before the comet comes, otherwise there will not be a world to save. Downhearted by this news, Aang feels overwhelmed and doubts his abilities to successfully face the Fire Lord. His friends, however, declare that they will fight alongside him to have a better shot at defeating Ozai. With Aang comforted, Team Avatar joins together in a group hug, including a reluctant Zuko.

paragraphs.body: Later, Zuko teaches Aang the technique of ${link_0}. Zuko explains that though being able to hold such energy is exhilarating, one wrong move could prove fatal. Aang thinks Katara would still be able to heal him if that happened, but she says she used up all of the spiritual healing water when Azula shot Aang with ${link_1} before. Zuko stresses that against an opponent as vicious as Ozai, Aang has no choice but to take his life. Aang anxiously replies he will do just that.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Later, Zuko teaches Aang the technique of lightning redirection. Zuko explains that though being able to hold such energy is exhilarating, one wrong move could prove fatal. Aang thinks Katara would still be able to heal him if that happened, but she says she used up all of the spiritual healing water when Azula shot Aang with lightning before. Zuko stresses that against an opponent as vicious as Ozai, Aang has no choice but to take his life. Aang anxiously replies he will do just that.

paragraphs.body: Sokka makes a dummy, naming it the "Melon Lord", to use as practice for the group's strategy to take out the Fire Lord. The rest of the group, except Toph who acts as the Melon Lord's forces, creates a diversion to provide Aang with the opportunity to deliver the finishing blow. During training however, Aang fails to finish off the puppet, saying it did not feel right because of his peaceful nature. Irritated, Sokka slices the puppet's head in two to show Aang how it is done, leaving Aang nervous and worried.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Sokka makes a dummy, naming it the "Melon Lord", to use as practice for the group's strategy to take out the Fire Lord. The rest of the group, except Toph who acts as the Melon Lord's forces, creates a diversion to provide Aang with the opportunity to deliver the finishing blow. During training however, Aang fails to finish off the puppet, saying it did not feel right because of his peaceful nature. Irritated, Sokka slices the puppet's head in two to show Aang how it is done, leaving Aang nervous and worried.

paragraphs.body: That night as they eat dinner, Katara finds a picture of a baby in the attic and shows it to everybody, thinking it is Zuko. Much to everyone's surprise, Zuko corrects Katara, noting that the picture is of his father. When Suki states that Ozai looks "so sweet and innocent", he adds that the "sweet little kid grew up to be a monster, and the worst father in the history of fathers." Aang argues that even though Ozai is a terrible person, he is still a human being and should not be killed. Seeing all life as sacred and trying to think of another way to defeat him, Aang suggests to make large pots filled with glue, so he can use "gluebending" to stick Ozai's arms and legs together to prevent him from bending ever again. To poke fun at the idea, Zuko adds that they could subsequently show Ozai his baby pictures in order to trigger his good side. When Aang excitedly asks if the plan would work, Zuko angrily yells that it would not. Aang starts to restlessly pace around, musing that killing goes against everything he learned from the monks. Sokka jokes that as the ${link_0}, the universe would probably forgive him for taking a person's life if it was done in the name of keeping balance. Furious, Aang berates everyone for not being able to understand the position he is in and he storms off. Katara starts to follow him, but Zuko suggests he be left alone to figure the problem out himself.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: That night as they eat dinner, Katara finds a picture of a baby in the attic and shows it to everybody, thinking it is Zuko. Much to everyone's surprise, Zuko corrects Katara, noting that the picture is of his father. When Suki states that Ozai looks "so sweet and innocent", he adds that the "sweet little kid grew up to be a monster, and the worst father in the history of fathers." Aang argues that even though Ozai is a terrible person, he is still a human being and should not be killed. Seeing all life as sacred and trying to think of another way to defeat him, Aang suggests to make large pots filled with glue, so he can use "gluebending" to stick Ozai's arms and legs together to prevent him from bending ever again. To poke fun at the idea, Zuko adds that they could subsequently show Ozai his baby pictures in order to trigger his good side. When Aang excitedly asks if the plan would work, Zuko angrily yells that it would not. Aang starts to restlessly pace around, musing that killing goes against everything he learned from the monks. Sokka jokes that as the Avatar, the universe would probably forgive him for taking a person's life if it was done in the name of keeping balance. Furious, Aang berates everyone for not being able to understand the position he is in and he storms off. Katara starts to follow him, but Zuko suggests he be left alone to figure the problem out himself.

paragraphs.body: Aang meditates on the beach house porch, accompanied by ${link_0}. He and Momo later fall asleep, and with the sudden appearance of a ${link_1} off shore, Aang is unconsciously drawn toward the island with Momo flying after him.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Aang meditates on the beach house porch, accompanied by Momo. He and Momo later fall asleep, and with the sudden appearance of a strange small island off shore, Aang is unconsciously drawn toward the island with Momo flying after him.

paragraphs.body: The next morning, the others prepare to leave the beach house, but they cannot find Aang anywhere. They check the beach and find his footprints in the sand, leading into the wide open ocean. They deduce Aang did not run away, as his ${link_0} and ${link_1} are still at the house; that he was not captured, as there was no sign of a struggle; and that Aang is not on a ${link_2} journey, because his body would still be with them. They decide to split up to search ${link_3}. Before they search, Toph states that, "Everyone else has been on a life changing journey with Zuko; now it's my turn", and she goes with Zuko. The search is futile, as no one finds Aang, and they additionally realize that Momo is gone as well. Sokka believes Appa has eaten Momo and comically climbs into Appa's mouth. They all look to Zuko as a leader, as he is an "expert on tracking Aang". Soon they are all flying on Appa toward the Earth Kingdom.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: The next morning, the others prepare to leave the beach house, but they cannot find Aang anywhere. They check the beach and find his footprints in the sand, leading into the wide open ocean. They deduce Aang did not run away, as his glider and Appa are still at the house; that he was not captured, as there was no sign of a struggle; and that Aang is not on a Spirit World journey, because his body would still be with them. They decide to split up to search Ember Island. Before they search, Toph states that, "Everyone else has been on a life changing journey with Zuko; now it's my turn", and she goes with Zuko. The search is futile, as no one finds Aang, and they additionally realize that Momo is gone as well. Sokka believes Appa has eaten Momo and comically climbs into Appa's mouth. They all look to Zuko as a leader, as he is an "expert on tracking Aang". Soon they are all flying on Appa toward the Earth Kingdom.

paragraphs.body: Meanwhile, preparing for departure with a grand ceremony at the ${link_0}, Fire Lord Ozai orders Azula to stay in the Fire Nation to be appointed the new Fire Lord. Initially angered to learn she will not be accompanying her father, Azula eventually concedes that the title of "Fire Lord Azula" "does seem appropriate". Ozai subsequently declares himself the ${link_1}, the ruler of the world, and departs for the ${link_2} ${link_3}.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Meanwhile, preparing for departure with a grand ceremony at the Royal Plaza, Fire Lord Ozai orders Azula to stay in the Fire Nation to be appointed the new Fire Lord. Initially angered to learn she will not be accompanying her father, Azula eventually concedes that the title of "Fire Lord Azula" "does seem appropriate". Ozai subsequently declares himself the Phoenix King, the ruler of the world, and departs for the airship base.

paragraphs.body: Back in the Earth Kingdom, Zuko leads the group into a tavern where they find ${link_0}, a bounty hunter, who has a ${link_1} which can track Aang. Somewhere else, Momo wakes Aang up, and Aang sees with great surprise he is on a mysterious island in the middle of the sea.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Back in the Earth Kingdom, Zuko leads the group into a tavern where they find June, a bounty hunter, who has a shirshu which can track Aang. Somewhere else, Momo wakes Aang up, and Aang sees with great surprise he is on a mysterious island in the middle of the sea.

paragraphs.body: Although ${link_0} appears in this episode, there is no credit for ${link_1}.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Although Actress Aang appears in this episode, there is no credit for Rachel Dratch.

paragraphs.body: When the group decided to look for Aang, Toph insisted on being with Zuko, stating how everyone else had a life-changing experience with him. This refers to Aang in "${link_0}", Sokka and Suki in "${link_1}" and "${link_2}", and Katara in "${link_3}" when each character went on their respective journeys with Zuko.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: When the group decided to look for Aang, Toph insisted on being with Zuko, stating how everyone else had a life-changing experience with him. This refers to Aang in "The Firebending Masters", Sokka and Suki in "The Boiling Rock, Part 1" and "Part 2", and Katara in "The Southern Raiders" when each character went on their respective journeys with Zuko.

paragraphs.body: When Katara and Suki are looking for Aang, they see the actors playing Aang and Toph from the play in "${link_0}".
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: When Katara and Suki are looking for Aang, they see the actors playing Aang and Toph from the play in "The Ember Island Players".

paragraphs.body: The music in the bar in which Team Avatar finds June is the same music from the dance party in "${link_0}". ${link_1} titled this song "${link_2}".
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: The music in the bar in which Team Avatar finds June is the same music from the dance party in "The Headband". The Track Team titled this song "Cave Jivin'".

paragraphs.body: The war meeting that took place in "${link_0}" is revealed in full in this episode, also revealing the event that triggered Zuko's decision to betray his father and join Aang.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: The war meeting that took place in "Nightmares and Daydreams" is revealed in full in this episode, also revealing the event that triggered Zuko's decision to betray his father and join Aang.

paragraphs.body: Colonel ${link_0}, the commander of the ${link_1}, makes a reappearance in this episode. Although addressed by Ozai as General, the credits still list him as Colonel Shinu.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Colonel Shinu, the commander of the Yuyan Archers, makes a reappearance in this episode. Although addressed by Ozai as General, the credits still list him as Colonel Shinu.

paragraphs.body: General ${link_0}, the high-ranking officer whom Zuko called out during the war meeting which ultimately led to the prince's banishment, is seen in the War Room during Zuko's flashback exchanging an uneasy glance with Shinu.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: General Bujing, the high-ranking officer whom Zuko called out during the war meeting which ultimately led to the prince's banishment, is seen in the War Room during Zuko's flashback exchanging an uneasy glance with Shinu.

paragraphs.body: In the beginning and throughout this episode, Toph wears her Earth Kingdom uniform, but for the brief section of clips when Zuko tells Aang to roar like a tigerdillo, Toph is seen wearing her Fire Nation disguise. Toph is also shown in her Fire Nation disguise while she is on her "field trip" with Zuko. This also occurs with Katara shortly before Sokka claims that Appa must have eaten Momo.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: In the beginning and throughout this episode, Toph wears her Earth Kingdom uniform, but for the brief section of clips when Zuko tells Aang to roar like a tigerdillo, Toph is seen wearing her Fire Nation disguise. Toph is also shown in her Fire Nation disguise while she is on her "field trip" with Zuko. This also occurs with Katara shortly before Sokka claims that Appa must have eaten Momo.

paragraphs.body: When Zuko is "teaching [Aang] a lesson" by attacking him, he chases him up a rock wall. Although it looks like he is clutching onto rock ledges or footholds as he climbs, there were really no ledges he could grasp onto.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: When Zuko is "teaching [Aang] a lesson" by attacking him, he chases him up a rock wall. Although it looks like he is clutching onto rock ledges or footholds as he climbs, there were really no ledges he could grasp onto.

paragraphs.body: When Sokka tells Zuko that Aang is not ready to face the Fire Lord, Aang's eyes are blue. His eyes are supposed to be a dark gray color, and when Sokka is yelling at him for refusing to take out the Melon Lord, his eyes are brown. His eyes change color multiple times throughout the episode.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: When Sokka tells Zuko that Aang is not ready to face the Fire Lord, Aang's eyes are blue. His eyes are supposed to be a dark gray color, and when Sokka is yelling at him for refusing to take out the Melon Lord, his eyes are brown. His eyes change color multiple times throughout the episode.

paragraphs.body: During the scene where General Shinu is giving his report to Ozai on the Earth Kingdom rebellions, Ozai is seen from behind and the central prong on the Fire Lord's ${link_0} is facing the wrong direction.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: During the scene where General Shinu is giving his report to Ozai on the Earth Kingdom rebellions, Ozai is seen from behind and the central prong on the Fire Lord's headpiece is facing the wrong direction.

paragraphs.body: In the group hug scene, right before Zuko joins, Aang's left foot does not have any toes.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: In the group hug scene, right before Zuko joins, Aang's left foot does not have any toes.

paragraphs.body: Due to a translation error, in the French version of the episode, Zuko says that his uncle created the lightning redirection when he learned waterbending, which is impossible, instead of saying that he studied waterbenders.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Due to a translation error, in the French version of the episode, Zuko says that his uncle created the lightning redirection when he learned waterbending, which is impossible, instead of saying that he studied waterbenders.

paragraphs.body: When Aang sleepwalks to the "island" he is barefoot, but when Momo wakes him up he is wearing shoes.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: When Aang sleepwalks to the "island" he is barefoot, but when Momo wakes him up he is wearing shoes.

paragraphs.body: When Katara and Suki are looking for Aang, they see ${link_0} circled by people, but actor ${link_1} is not there. He then appears out of nowhere.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: When Katara and Suki are looking for Aang, they see actress Aang circled by people, but actor Toph is not there. He then appears out of nowhere.

paragraphs.body: After Ozai tells Azula that she will be remaining in the Fire Nation, Ozai is seen from behind, and the gold trimmings on his robes are missing.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: After Ozai tells Azula that she will be remaining in the Fire Nation, Ozai is seen from behind, and the gold trimmings on his robes are missing.

paragraphs.body: When Ozai tells Azula that she is not coming with him to the Earth Kingdom, all the people who bowed to them before disappear, but when Ozai crowns himself Phoenix King, everybody returns to bowing to him, save for Azula, who remains absent.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: When Ozai tells Azula that she is not coming with him to the Earth Kingdom, all the people who bowed to them before disappear, but when Ozai crowns himself Phoenix King, everybody returns to bowing to him, save for Azula, who remains absent.

paragraphs.body: In Avatar Extras, it said that Zuko was the first person to find the Avatar after he went missing for a hundred years, though this is not true as Katara and Sokka were the first to find Aang.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: In Avatar Extras, it said that Zuko was the first person to find the Avatar after he went missing for a hundred years, though this is not true as Katara and Sokka were the first to find Aang.

paragraphs.body: There are times when ${link_0} is the color of a regular sword rather than the usual black.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: There are times when Sokka's sword is the color of a regular sword rather than the usual black.

paragraphs.body: This episode was part of an event called "Countdown to the Comet". The new episodes of Avatar began airing on July 14, starting with "${link_0}", followed by "${link_1}", The Boiling Rock parts ${link_2} and ${link_3}, "${link_4}", "${link_5}", and finally ${link_6}.

links.body: Sozin's Comet parts one through four

section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: This episode was part of an event called "Countdown to the Comet". The new episodes of Avatar began airing on July 14, starting with "The Western Air Temple", followed by "The Firebending Masters", The Boiling Rock parts one and two, "The Southern Raiders", "The Ember Island Players", and finally Sozin's Comet parts one through four.

paragraphs.body: The chanting that can be heard when the Island/lion turtle calls to Aang, causing him to sleepwalk/swim to him, is a Buddhist chant, "Na Mo A Mi Tuo Fo" (spellings vary) and can also be heard during "${link_0}", when Zhao and his soldiers are about to attack Aang, as well as in "${link_1}" when Aang goes into the Avatar State and walks into the pond.

links.body: The Siege of the North, Part 2

section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: The chanting that can be heard when the Island/lion turtle calls to Aang, causing him to sleepwalk/swim to him, is a Buddhist chant, "Na Mo A Mi Tuo Fo" (spellings vary) and can also be heard during "Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku", when Zhao and his soldiers are about to attack Aang, as well as in "The Siege of the North, Part 2" when Aang goes into the Avatar State and walks into the pond.

paragraphs.body: Sokka's terrible sense of aesthetics is shown once more. Here, he creates an ugly sand sculpture of Suki which he is extremely proud of, despite its hideous appearance.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Sokka's terrible sense of aesthetics is shown once more. Here, he creates an ugly sand sculpture of Suki which he is extremely proud of, despite its hideous appearance.

paragraphs.body: During the bar scene, June is seen fighting a man who she throws into a table; this character bears a striking resemblance to "Ryu", the protagonist of the "Street Fighter" game series. She arm-wrestled the same guy in "${link_0}".
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: During the bar scene, June is seen fighting a man who she throws into a table; this character bears a striking resemblance to "Ryu", the protagonist of the "Street Fighter" game series. She arm-wrestled the same guy in "Bato of the Water Tribe".

paragraphs.body: Though everyone else is in their season three outfit, Toph and Sokka are in their season two outfits, except in the part where Toph searches for Aang with Zuko, when she is wearing her season three outfit. Also, Katara switches between both of her season three outfits throughout the episode.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: Though everyone else is in their season three outfit, Toph and Sokka are in their season two outfits, except in the part where Toph searches for Aang with Zuko, when she is wearing her season three outfit. Also, Katara switches between both of her season three outfits throughout the episode.

paragraphs.body: This episode has the longest recap, due to the fact that this is the first part of the series finale. Viewers are reminded of the many cliffhangers and plot twists that are to be resolved during the four-part series finale. However, in other appearances of this episode, "The Legend So Far" has been shortened.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: This episode has the longest recap, due to the fact that this is the first part of the series finale. Viewers are reminded of the many cliffhangers and plot twists that are to be resolved during the four-part series finale. However, in other appearances of this episode, "The Legend So Far" has been shortened.

paragraphs.body: This episode is the first part of the two hour movie, Sozin's Comet, which pulled in an average of 5.6 million total viewers and achieved the highest Avatar rating ever with kids 6-11 and teens.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: This episode is the first part of the two hour movie, Sozin's Comet, which pulled in an average of 5.6 million total viewers and achieved the highest Avatar rating ever with kids 6-11 and teens.

paragraphs.body: The order in which Sokka mentions the elements is the order in which they are in the Avatar Cycle.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: The order in which Sokka mentions the elements is the order in which they are in the Avatar Cycle.

paragraphs.body: For the first time in the four part series finale, a secondary issue is raised in importance before Aang's well being. When asked what is going on, Sokka first points out that, "Zuko's gone crazy! I made a sand sculpture of Suki and he destroyed it!" Waiting a few moments before saying, "Oh, and he's attacking Aang."
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: For the first time in the four part series finale, a secondary issue is raised in importance before Aang's well being. When asked what is going on, Sokka first points out that, "Zuko's gone crazy! I made a sand sculpture of Suki and he destroyed it!" Waiting a few moments before saying, "Oh, and he's attacking Aang."

paragraphs.body: At the end of "${link_0}", Katara warned Zuko that she would not hesitate to kill him if he were to hurt Aang. She had forgiven him in "${link_1}", so she might have decided to wonder why he attacked Aang this time rather than retaliate.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: At the end of "The Western Air Temple", Katara warned Zuko that she would not hesitate to kill him if he were to hurt Aang. She had forgiven him in "The Southern Raiders", so she might have decided to wonder why he attacked Aang this time rather than retaliate.

paragraphs.body: The passage of power from Ozai to Azula over the Fire Nation is very similar to how emperors would manage their home nation when given the title as Holy Roman Emperor in the Medieval Era. At the time, the Holy Roman Empire was considered the largest collection of power in the European Sphere.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King

paragraphs.body: This is the second episode in the series where all the members of Team Avatar have worn swimsuits, with "${link_0}" being the first. It is the first time Suki has worn a swimsuit in the series.
section: Sozin's Comet, Part 1: The Phoenix King
paragraphs.text: This is the second episode in the series where all the members of Team Avatar have worn swimsuits, with "The Beach" being the first. It is the first time Suki has worn a swimsuit in the series.
